meanings.definition: The quality or state of causing harm or damage.
meanings.sent1: The destructiveness of the storm left a path of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter bravely faced the destructiveness of the flames to save the family trapped inside.
meanings.sent3: The destructiveness of the mischievous puppy was evident in the chewed-up slippers scattered around the house.
meanings.sent4: The destructiveness of gossip can tear apart friendships just like a tornado destroys homes.
meanings.sent5: The destructiveness of the earthquake was so powerful that it reshaped the landscape forever.

meanings.definition: The tendency to destroy or ruin.
meanings.sent1: The destructiveness of the child's tantrum was overwhelming for the exhausted parents.
meanings.sent2: The destructiveness of war can have long-lasting effects on communities and families.
meanings.sent3: The destructiveness of the raccoon's nightly raids on the garbage cans became a neighborhood legend.
meanings.sent4: The destructiveness of procrastination slowly erodes away one's chances of success.
meanings.sent5: The destructiveness of unchecked anger can lead to irreversible consequences.
